headline: Right-Wing Media Says Virus Fears Were Whipped Up to Hurt Trump
snippet: Rush Limbaugh and Fox News pundits accused Democrats and journalists of “politicizing and actually weaponizing” an infectious disease.
abstract: Rush Limbaugh and Fox News pundits accused Democrats and journalists of “politicizing and actually weaponizing” an infectious disease.
byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and Rachel Abrams

headline: Democrats, Your Time Is Running Out
snippet: Amy Klobuchar, Pete Buttigieg, Tom Steyer, Mike Bloomberg and perhaps Elizabeth Warren need to get out of the race.
abstract: Amy Klobuchar, Pete Buttigieg, Tom Steyer, Mike Bloomberg and perhaps Elizabeth Warren need to get out of the race.

headline: On Politics: Where Things Stand Before South Carolina
snippet: This is your morning tip sheet.

headline: Will the Economy Re-elect Trump? Should It?
snippet: People often vote with their wallets, crediting, or blaming, the president for things that economists say are outside any policymaker’s control.
abstract: People often vote with their wallets, crediting, or blaming, the president for things that economists say are outside any policymaker’s control.

headline: Late Night Awaits Mike Pence’s Cure for the Coronavirus
snippet: The vice president has been put in charge of America’s response to the outbreak. “In other words, it’s been nice knowing you,” Conan O’Brien said.
abstract: The vice president has been put in charge of America’s response to the outbreak. “In other words, it’s been nice knowing you,” Conan O’Brien said.

headline: When a Pandemic Meets a Personality Cult
snippet: The Trump team confirms all of our worst fears.
abstract: The Trump team confirms all of our worst fears.

headline: Bloomberg seems more at ease in a town hall format.
I Can’t Hear You, There’s a Debate Going On
snippet: In a rush for attention at the Democrats’ noisy showdown, CBS’s moderators got stampeded, our television critic writes.
abstract: In a rush for attention at the Democrats’ noisy showdown, CBS’s moderators got stampeded.

headline: Why Russia Is Rooting for Both Trump and Sanders
snippet: Why Russia Is rooting for both President Trump and Bernie Sanders.
abstract: The Russian government is again trying to meddle in the presidential election. In doing so, they’re working to aid two very different candidates.

headline: The Democratic Party Devours Itself
snippet: At a raucous debate, Bernie Sanders was the target, but who really got hurt?
abstract: At a raucous debate, Bernie Sanders was the target, but who really got hurt?

headline: Government Eyes War Powers to Speed Medical Manufacturing Ahead of Virus
snippet: The Trump administration may use a law enacted during the Korean War to speed up the manufacturing of medical supplies.
abstract: Alex M. Azar II, the health secretary, raised the prospect of invoking a Korean War-era law to expand production of materials for national security purposes in a potential coronavirus outbreak.
byline: By Noah Weiland and Emily Cochrane

headline: Trump Names Mike Pence to Lead Coronavirus Response
snippet: President Trump named Vice President Mike Pence to lead the effort and sought to reassure Americans that his government was controlling the virus’s spread.
abstract: President Trump sought to reassure the country that his government was controlling the spread of the coronavirus after his administration weathered days of criticism.
byline: By Michael D. Shear, Noah Weiland and Katie Rogers

headline: White House Asks Congress for Billions to Fight Coronavirus
snippet: The request arrived at the same time the Trump administration is proposing cuts to health programs across the government and as health officials across the nation struggle to keep up with costs.
abstract: The request arrived at the same time the Trump administration is proposing cuts to health programs across the government and as health officials across the nation struggle to keep up with costs.
byline: By Noah Weiland, Emily Cochrane and Maggie Haberman

headline: C.D.C. Officials Warn of Coronavirus Outbreaks in the U.S.
snippet: Clusters of infection are likely in the U.S., health officials said. Some lawmakers doubted that the Trump administration was ready.
abstract: Clusters of infection are likely in American communities, health officials said. Some lawmakers questioned whether the nation is prepared.
byline: By Pam Belluck and Noah Weiland
